text: 'congress passes short term funding bill avoid government shutdown show caption hide caption congress passes funding bill avoid shutdown house senate approve short term spending bill keeps government open least another week april ap washington hours left government shutdown midnight congress passed stopgap funding bill friday keep government open another week house members voted approve legislation gives lawmakers midnight may try reach compromise legislation fund government rest fiscal year ends sept senate approved weeklong funding bill voice vote friday president trump said sign law fact last minute trying keep government open sad said rep jim mcgovern mass manufactured crisis edge cliff congressional leaders white house wanted prevent unpopular shutdown would closed national parks monuments delayed tax refunds furloughed thousands federal workers shutdown would taken effect saturday trumps day office unless congress acted read todays measure shows american people making good faith effort keep government open said house rules committee chairman pete sessions r texas ideal support effort provide colleagues time reach final agreement legislation fund government fiscal year democrats decided support stopgap measure became clear house republicans would force vote week new version bill repeal replace affordable care act better known obamacare minority whip steny hoyer md democrats said would vote weeklong bill fund government gop leaders went ahead health care vote hoyer said feared republicans trying push bill give trump big victory first days however speaker paul ryan r wis said would bring health care legislation floor sure votes pass many moderate republicans expressed concern week latest version bill federal programs would continue funded existing levels stopgap measure approved congress resolution would also extend health care benefits retired union coal miners may bipartisan support making benefits permanent government operating temporary spending bill congress passed december fund agencies april lawmakers return work monday five days reach deal face another possible shutdown two major stumbling blocks compromise largely resolved week tuesday trump backed demand immediate funding southwest border wall deciding fight money budget instead democrats warned issue would result shutdown fierce opposition wall border state republicans also oppose barrier calling expensive ineffective department homeland security estimated wall cost nearly billion democrats said price tag could high billion wednesday white house backed threat stop paying federal subsidies help low income americans pay health insurance affordable care act democrats want language final bill ensure subsidies owed health insurance companies obamacare paid insurance premiums increase low income families trump threatened withhold payments force democrats bargain health care bill replace aca white house officials said wednesday payments continue however sticking points remain house minority leader nancy pelosi calif said still disagreements rule requires financial advisers act best interests clients saving retirement democrats want protect rule funding bill republicans want scrap saying confusing burdensome democrats also seeking health care funding puerto rico expected run medicaid money year resulting nearly million residents losing medical coverage trump denounced democrats efforts taxpayer bailout puerto rico us territory receives less half medicaid funding states receive rep tom cole r okla serves house appropriations committee said believes republicans democrats reach bipartisan deal next week fund government september house leaders said intend introduce funding bill monday night setting vote thursday im confident back bill american people proud cole said despite concessions trump expected win support increased defense spending border security include wall trump sent congress emergency request billion bill included billion extra spending defense combat operations billion border security including wall congress likely give president million additional defense spending extra money border security '
